Article.ArticleTitle: Characteristics of surface ozone pollution and its correlations with meteorological factors: the case of Xiangtan.

AbstractText: Based on ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) monitoring data for Xiangtan and meteorological observation data for 2020-2022, we examined ozone pollution characteristics and the effects of meteorological factors on daily maximum 8-h average ozone (O<sub>3-8h</sub>) concentrations in Xiangtan. Thus, we observed significant increases as well as notable seasonal variations in O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentrations in Xiangtan during the period considered. The ozone and temperature change response slope (K<sub>O3-T</sub>) indicated that local emissions had no significant effect on O<sub>3-8h</sub> generation. Further, average O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentration and maximum temperature (T<sub>max</sub>) values showed a polynomial distribution. Specifically, at T<sub>max</sub> < 27 °C, it increased almost linearly with increasing temperature, and at T<sub>max</sub> between 27 and 37 °C, it showed an upward curvilinear trend as temperature increased, but at a much lower rate. Then, at T<sub>max</sub> > 37 °C, it decreased with increasing temperature. With respect to relative humidity (RH), the average O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentration primarily exceeded the standard value when RH varied in the range of 45-65%, which is the key humidity range for O<sub>3</sub> pollution, and the inflection point for the correlation curve between O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentration and RH appeared at ~55%. Furthermore, at wind speeds (WSs) below 1.5 m∙s<sup>-1</sup>, O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentration increased rapidly, and at WSs in the 1.5-2 m∙s<sup>-1</sup> range, it increased at a much faster rate. However, at WSs > 2 m∙s<sup>-1</sup>, it decreased slowly with increasing WS. O<sub>3-8h</sub> concentration also showed the tendency to exceed the standard value when the dominant wind directions in Xiangtan were easterly or southeasterly.
